cppcoreguidelines-avoid-do-while.description:
Description

Warns when using
do-while
loops. They are less readable than plain
while
loops, since the termination condition is at the end and the
condition is not checked prior to the first iteration.
This can lead to subtle bugs.

This check implements
ES.75
from the C++ Core Guidelines.

Examples:

int
x
;
do
{
std
::
cin
>>
x
;
// ...
}
while
(
x
<
0
);
cppcoreguidelines-avoid-do-while.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

Options
IgnoreMacros
Ignore the check when analyzing macros. This is useful for safely defining function-like macros:
#define FOO_BAR(x) \
do { \
foo(x); \
bar(x); \
} while(0)
Defaults to
false
.
